title: Disney film shines Hollywood spotlight on Mackenzie
text:
Disney film shines Hollywood spotlight on Mackenzie DAISY HUDSON Last updated 16:59, February 22 2017 MYTCHALL BRANSGROVE/FAIRFAX NZ 
Crews film a new Disney movie on the shores of Lake Pukaki. 
A major Hollywood blockbuster being filmed on the shores of Lake Pukaki could shine an international spotlight on the Mackenzie District. 
The $140 million Disney film A Wrinkle in Time is jam packed with star power, with Oprah Winfrey, Reese Witherspoon, Mindy Kaling, and Chris Pine some of big names attached to the project. 
What appeared to be a film set, along with a sea of tents and several cranes, was visible on the shores of Lake Pukaki on Wednesday. MYTCHALL BRANSGROVE/FAIRFAX NZ 
The movie has permits to film at the lake until February 28. 
Land Information New Zealand (LINZ) owns the land being used for filming.

A LINZ spokeswoman said Fortinbras Productions Limited was authorised to use the land to film a Disney movie. SUPPLIED 
Hollywood star Reese Witherspoon checks out Lake Tekapo during a horse trek with Mackenzie Alpine Horse Trekking guide Ginny Sutton. 
It was permitted to film on the land from February 20 to 28. 
The film's stars had previously been shooting in Central Otago and around Lake Hawea. 
Oscar winner Witherspoon took some time out from filming to enjoy the scenery around Lake Tekapo on Tuesday. 
She embarked on a horse trek around the lake, taking to Instagram to share the excursion with her 8.6 million followers. 
Mackenzie Alpine Horse Trekking owner Sarah Simpson said she only found out Witherspoon was interested in a trek 15 minutes before she arrived. 
"It was a cool surprise. 
"She was lovely, had a really great sense of humour, and she really enjoyed the trek." 
Witherspoon took "a particular shine" to one of the horses, Fergus, who she later posted a photo of on social media. 
The social media exposure was "pretty cool", Simpson said. 
"We're such a small business, so anything like that is amazing." 
Mackenzie Mayor Graham Smith said he was aware a movie was being filmed in the district, but did not have any details. 
Smith said the international attention the film could bring to the area was "tremendous". 
"It's great advertising for the district, and it's further evidence of the growth we're experiencing, that people want to see our majestic scenery. 
"It's very exciting." 
He believed it was the first major film to be shot in the area since the Lord of the Rings trilogy. 
Based on the 1963 novel by Madeleine L'Engle, A Wrinkle in Time tells the story of a brother and sister who travel through space and time to try and rescue their brilliant scientist father.
